paragraphs.body: Gurihiru is comprised of Chifuyu Sasaki (left) and Naoko Kawano (right).
paragraphs.text: Gurihiru is comprised of Chifuyu Sasaki (left) and Naoko Kawano (right).

paragraphs.body: Gurihiru (Japanese: グリヒル) is a Japan-based comic book artist duo made up of Chifuyu Sasaki, who does penciling and inking, and Naoko Kawano, who does coloring. Though its comic book endeavors are centered in the United States, Gurihiru also illustrates character designs for games and animations in Japan.
paragraphs.text: Gurihiru (Japanese: グリヒル) is a Japan-based comic book artist duo made up of Chifuyu Sasaki, who does penciling and inking, and Naoko Kawano, who does coloring. Though its comic book endeavors are centered in the United States, Gurihiru also illustrates character designs for games and animations in Japan.

paragraphs.body: Among the team's major affiliates is Marvel Worldwide, Inc., having worked on popular American comic book franchises such as Thor, Captain America, and Wolverine. More recently, Gurihiru has come together with ${link_0} and ${link_1} to continue the story of ${link_2} in graphic novel format, a collaborative effort that has spawned five trilogies: ${link_3}, ${link_4}, ${link_5}, ${link_6}, and ${link_7}. Before these, Gurihiru also colored Avatar ${link_8} for ${link_9} and ${link_10} that have since been compiled in Avatar: The Last Airbender - The Lost Adventures, along with one Free Comic Book Day addition. On June 9, 2017 the duo announced the end of their collaboration with Nickelodeon and Dark Horse Comics after six years, deciding to move on from the franchise to other projects.
paragraphs.text: Among the team's major affiliates is Marvel Worldwide, Inc., having worked on popular American comic book franchises such as Thor, Captain America, and Wolverine. More recently, Gurihiru has come together with Nickelodeon and Dark Horse Comics to continue the story of Avatar: The Last Airbender in graphic novel format, a collaborative effort that has spawned five trilogies: The Promise, The Search, The Rift, Smoke and Shadow, and North and South. Before these, Gurihiru also colored Avatar comics for Nickelodeon Magazine and Nickelodeon Comics Club that have since been compiled in Avatar: The Last Airbender - The Lost Adventures, along with one Free Comic Book Day addition. On June 9, 2017 the duo announced the end of their collaboration with Nickelodeon and Dark Horse Comics after six years, deciding to move on from the franchise to other projects.
